contextId.information: "the name of one of the women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"while Naomi was living in Moab she heard." It is implied that the news came from Israel. AT: "she heard from Israel while in the region of Moab" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: she had heard in the region of Moab

contextId.information: "Ruth clung to her." AT: "Ruth refused to leave her" or "Ruth would not leave her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Ruth is referring to Naomi's people, the Israelites. AT: "I will consider the people of your country as being my own people" or "I will consider your relatives as my own relatives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: your people will be my people

contextId.information: It is implied that Ruth carried the grain home. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: She lifted it up and went into the city

contextId.information: "female workers you have been working with" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: female workers you have been with

contextId.information: "if he will not marry his kinsman's widow and father children for his dead relative" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: if he will not do the duty of a kinsman

contextId.information: What Ruth meant by this question can be made more clear. AT: "What happened, my daughter?" or "How did Boaz act toward you?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: How did you do, my daughter?

contextId.information: "father of King David." Though "king" is not stated, it was clear to the original audience that David was King David. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
